channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 tonne backs left with rubbish and soil, 30th November
item.description:
This has been here for a while someone has dumped 2 tonne bags of rubbish and soil

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daunt Road, Upton St. Leonards, Stroud
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long pothole at edge of road at entrance to Moat Cottage., 30th November
item.description:
At entrance to Moat Cottage, Off Kidnappers Lane. Postcode GL53 0NR. Edge of road being eroded away all along entrance & filling up with water. Area used as a passing place when lorries etc coming up lane. Building site @ Cherringtons nearby due to be developed shortly by Newlands so lots of construction traffic will be using this location!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole next to recent repair, 30th November
item.description:
Below Green Acres, Postcode GL53 0NP travelling down Kidnappers Lane from Church Road on right hand side near kerb. A very recent pothole was repaired right next to hole. Full of water & quite deep.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in front of 36 Cudnall Street GL538HG, 30th November
item.description:
Pothole developing in front of 36 Cudnall Street near the entrance to Hamilton Street. The tarmac is loose and hole getting worse. It has been there for several weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Cudnall Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris in the cycle lane, 30th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Dumped fridge with tank removed, 30th November
item.description:
This is on Shakespeare Road near the Junction with Goldsmith Road. Could somebody pick it up please? Could somebody also explain why the tanks are being cut off these fridges before they are dumped?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldsmith Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Adopted highway is not reflected on map and not clear on site, 30th November
item.description:
The centre section of the Royal Oak car park is shown on various maps as adopted highway leading off Old Gloucester Road. It is not shown as such on the LR Title Plan for the Royal Oak (title noGR240931 ), nor on Gloucestershire Highways maps. These therefore need to be corrected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Roadworks you undertook this year, 30th November
item.description:
Hello. This year you tarmac our road after undertaking work. Well the tarmac was not paid property and is in a dip so the water does not run to the drain. The drain has a terrible smell also. But most important is to rectify the tarmac outside the house which dips so badly that water does not move

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Sandford Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridge is damaged/missing problem, 29th November
item.description:
handrail on bridleway bridge may be damaged due to fallen tree. - I am not sure if this is our bridge or not, but could you check the rails please? landowner is going to remove tree
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeat report: Path needs levelling tamac, 29th November
item.description:
See photos of marked path with white paint showing 20m length of path. It's a hazard trying to cycle or run on the edge of the path due to racking and sinking . Location starts at light No 22 Up Hatherley Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
